author: Chris
text: Hi my name is Chris and Grailed helped me lose over $200 this holiday season. Hooray! Grailed is 50/50. You either get somebody honest who will send you what you paid for, or you will get a scammer. Some scammers have made it far in grailed because people do not know how to tell whether their item is authentic or not. Long story short, i received a fake from Grailed and they are not helping me with this purchase at all. They rely on a flawed photo authenticator to prove whether or not your item is real. Maybe you can fool some people, but for those of us who really know the truth, you know having a fake is blasphemy. I would rather die than wear a fake and because of Grailed i might be forced to wear a fake Vlone shirt i recently purchased from this garbage site. I might have to wear this fake Vlone shirt to take out the trash or go workout in the gym because Grailed "buyer protection" does not protect anybody at all. Good luck if you get scammed. The people who rated this site poorly did so for a reason. And im here to vouch for that reason. Dont waste your time here because once **it hits the fan there is nobody there to help clean it up. Hopefully you arent looking at this review after you made a bad purchase because im here to tell you that only luck is going to help at this point.
title: Im in the red now

author: Andrew Tachiera
text:
Kevin, customer support at Grailed, refuses to offer me any recourse for a purchase made where the item differed from the post and description.

 Grailed is allowing incorrect posts to be listed until the item is bought. Then it appears no recourse is offered because they hide behind the "significantly differs" language in your purchase guarantee policy.

author: Natallia
text:
I've been using Grailed on and off to browse through listings without having done anything else (to my knowledge).

After not using the app for a while I decided to reinstall it and unfortunately had to encounter that my account got frozen, because I allegedly violated their code of conduct.

I tried contacting them through their contact form, which wasn't and still isn't working. As well as through 2 different emails to which I haven't received a response to this date (at least half a year ago). – I eventually gave up.

Now I tried again through their Twitter support, which to my surprise replied and simply explained that I took part in fraudulent activity without giving me an exact case.

In conclusion: My account and therefore also my PayPal has been banned without me even knowing what I did wrong.
title: Support non-existent: Account frozen for no reason
